text: hey guys it's Elise welcome back to my
cupcake addiction on today's episode I
am making Twix flavored cupcakes so
these guys have got a biscuit base a
caramel cupcake chocolate caramel
frosting they're drizzle rim milk
chocolate and to top them off we've got
a syringe full of gooey caramel that you
can either squirt into the middle or you
can drizzle on top let's get started
so today's recipe is a small batch
recipe it's only gonna make you six
cupcakes but there's only one egg so
it's super easy to double triple or
quadruple you're going to need some of
our perfectly pipeable buttercream
frosting I'll link to that recipe in the
description box down below I've got some
shortbread biscuits some compound milk
chocolate which is chocolate it doesn't
contain cocoa butter a single egg some
butter some oil and some whole milk
you'll also need some brown sugar some
additional butter and some flour as
always I'm going to leave where you can
find all of your recipe quantities and
conversions in the description box below
I've got a tin of pre-made caramel a
ziploc bag a disposable piping bag which
I'm pairing with an open round tip
piping tip today and I've also got a
little bit of vanilla essence you've got
a couple of Twix bars there purely for
decoration and also some little syringes
I just bought these from a pharmacy and
they're about 50 cents each
you're going to need a cupcake tray with
just six cupcake liners and I've also
got a spoon a pair of scissors a sharp
knife and a rolling pin first up we're
going to make our base so I've just got
six of those shortbread cookies check
them into a ziploc bag and then pound
them with a rolling pin getting rid of
any frustration or anger you might have
and really pulverizing those little
shortbread cookies melt your smaller
quantity of butter and then you just
want to pour that over the top of your
crush biscuit and stir it through till
it's really well combined take a couple
of teaspoons of that mixture pop it into
the base of each of your little cupcake
liners and then use the end of your
rolling pin to really squish those
cookie bases down so they're nice and
tight and firmly packed set those guys
off to the side and then it's time to
get into our cake batter so I'm going to
use an electric mixer and it really
doesn't matter if you use a paddle or a
whisk attachment here pop in your brown
sugar your softened butter so it
shouldn't be
melted but should be nice and soft and
your little bit of vanilla essence in
goes your oil here and then you want to
mix that on our high-speed for about two
minutes you just want to cream that
butter and sugar mixture together really
nicely fill it's light and fluffy while
that's mixing add in your egg and just
let it go for another 15 or 20 seconds
to mix that egg through nicely and then
you can turn your mixer off add in your
flour and your milk and from this point
you don't want to over beat your mixture
here so just give it about twenty or
thirty seconds till those dry
ingredients are really nicely combined
your mixture should be quite nice and
light and fluffy
spoon your mixture out on top of your
little biscuit basis till all of your
cupcake liners are two-thirds full and
pop those off into a moderate oven for
about 14 minutes or until they spring
back when touched in the middle canned
caramel can tend to come out of the can
a little bit lumpy so give it a good
whisk with a hand whisk or an electric
mixer so it's really nice and smooth and
then you want to use your little
syringes to suck up a generous amount 5
mils to be exact of that caramel wipe
off the ends of them and set them aside
on a tray just so that they're ready to
go when it comes to decorating split
your buttercream frosting now into two
separate bowls and I've got some melted
chocolate in One Bowl and then I've got
some of that leftover caramel in the
other Bowl so I'm going to take just a
couple of teaspoons of the caramel
because that's going to thin your icing
down and make it a little bit moister so
don't start with your icing too thin
here and then I'm going to take a couple
of spoonfuls of the melted chocolate
and put it into the other half you want
to stir both of those through really
vigorously so what you're ending up with
is half caramel frosting and half milk
chocolate frosting cut the end off a
disposable piping bag and pop in your
piping tip and then you just want to
spoon in both flavors so I've showed you
how to do this a couple of times at the
rainbow frostings you basically just
want to open the bag up and you want a
half fill one side of the bag with your
chocolate frosting and then after the
other side of the bag with your caramel
frosting just carefully using your spoon
push both of those at about the same
time down to the end of the piping tip
and they give them a little test squeeze
in a bolt you've got both of those
colors of frosting coming out at the
same time give you kind of like a dual
color swirl scoop the rest of your
melted chocolate into a ziploc bag and
your cupcakes should
out of the oven and completely cooled
before you start to decorate them they
are going to be a little more golden on
top than a traditional vanilla cupcake
because if the brown sugar we've used in
the recipe take a knife and you just
want to really roughly chop those Twix
bars and you're only going to use like
one piece on each of these cupcakes or
more if you like use your dual colored
frosting to make a really nice little
high
smooth swirl on the top of each of your
Twix cupcakes and then you want to snip
the tip of your ziploc bag take your
ziplock bag and you're just going to
drizzle sort of randomly little curls of
that melted milk chocolate on top which
is going to provide kinda the crunch of
the chocolaty from a Twix and then you
want to add in a nice little triangle of
Twix on top and shove one of those
syringes right down into the center of
the cake so you actually want to shove
it right down in so that it doesn't
topple over when you want to serve those
your guests can either squirt that
delicious caramel straight into the
center of their Twix cupcakes so that it
bursts out when they eat it or they can
take this orange and they can drizzle it
over the top of all of that chocolatey
frosting you Twix see goodness I hope
you guys have enjoyed today's Twix
cupcake small batch recipe from my
cupcake addiction if you're not already
subscribed to the channel make sure you
do for more small batch recipes I will
leave a link to this small batch
playlist in the description box below
and as always thanks very much for
watching
